title: Regression in typeck from beta to nightly

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Works on stable and beta but not on nigthly

I tried this code in the playground:

```rust
struct X {
    a: [usize;26],
}
impl X {
    pub fn foo()->Self{
        let a = [usize;5];
        X{a:a}
    }
}
```

I expected to get:


    error[E0425]: unresolved name `usize`

Instead, this happened:

```
error: internal compiler error: ../src/librustc_typeck/check/mod.rs:4396: unexpected definition: PrimTy(TyUint(usize))
```

## Meta

    rustc 1.15.0-nightly (daf8c1dfc 2016-12-05)

